title: Yasuhiro Yoshida
text:
is a former <a href="Japan">Japan</a>ese <a href="Association%20football">football</a> player and manager.
Playing career.
Yoshida was born in <a href="Hiroshima">Hiroshima</a> on July 14, 1969. After graduating from <a href="Meiji%20University">Meiji University</a>, he joined <a href="Kashima%20Antlers">Kashima Antlers</a> in 1992. However he could hardly play in the match. He moved to <a href="Shimizu%20S-Pulse">Shimizu S-Pulse</a> in 1995 and played many matches. He moved to his local club <a href="Sanfrecce%20Hiroshima">Sanfrecce Hiroshima</a> in 1996 and played as regular player. He left the club end of 1999 season and moved to Brazil. However he could not sign with a club and he returned to Japan. He signed with <a href="Shimizu%20S-Pulse">Shimizu S-Pulse</a> in June 2000. The club won the champions <a href="2001%20Emperor%27s%20Cup">2001 Emperor's Cup</a>. From 2004, he could hardly play in the match and he moved to <a href="Japanese%20Regional%20Leagues">Regional Leagues</a> club <a href="FC%20Gifu">FC Gifu</a> in 2006. Although he could not play in the match, the club was promoted to <a href="Japan%20Football%20League">Japan Football League</a> in 2007 and <a href="J2%20League">J2 League</a> in 2008. From 2009, he played for <a href="FC%20Oribe%20Tajimi">FC Oribe Tajimi</a> (2009) and <a href="Fujieda%20MYFC">Fujieda MYFC</a> (2009-10). He retired end of 2010 season.
Coaching career.
After retirement, Yoshida became a coach for <a href="Tokyo%20Musashino%20City%20FC">Yokogawa Musashino</a> (later "Tokyo Musashino City FC") in 2011. He became a manager in 2013. He resigned end of 2017 season.
